definition: to cooperate/to harmonize/to help/to assist/to join

sentences.english: But the mood in Copenhagen yesterday did not seem conducive to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 但昨日哥本哈根的氣氛似乎不利於各方達成妥協。

sentences.english: Chen Duxiu was still for moderation and concessions to the Wuhan Kuomintang.
sentences.chinese: 陳獨秀卻依然主張對武漢國民黨的妥協退讓。

sentences.english: "There is no talk of capitulation, everybody's really happy, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “沒有任何妥協的談判，每個人都非常高興”他說到。

sentences.english: No one will compromise. We just argue.
sentences.chinese: 誰都不肯妥協，我們只是爭執。

sentences.english: There was no denying that she had compromised herself irretrievably .
sentences.chinese: 她已經無可挽救地跟他妥協，那是不能否認的了。

sentences.english: Pressure has already been put on the new Honduran government to reach a compromise.
sentences.chinese: 達成妥協的壓力現在回到新的洪都拉斯政府身上。

sentences.english: This has meant disappointments and compromises that are now causing the party harm.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着失望與妥協現在正造成工黨的傷害。

sentences.english: From time to time an atmosphere of compromise arises.
But the 38-year-old right-hander hasn't completely come to terms with the decision.
sentences.chinese: 但這位38歲的右投並未完全在此決定上妥協。

sentences.english: I. Guard yourself from being influenced by them to compromise your loyalty of God.
sentences.chinese: 對他們的影響作出提防，免致於對神的忠誠作出妥協。

sentences.english: He compromised with Democrats to achieve them.
sentences.chinese: 他與民主黨妥協以爭取他們的支持。

sentences.english: Hanan Ashrawi says it is Israeli intransigence that has long stood in the way of peace.
sentences.chinese: 阿什拉維說，是以色列的不妥協態度長期阻礙了和平。

sentences.english: Monica know is in trouble imelda, want to give her back to compromise.
sentences.chinese: 莫尼卡曉得是伊梅爾達在背後搗亂，想向她妥協。

sentences.english: We'll never compromise with the reactionary forces.
sentences.chinese: 我們決不向反動勢力妥協。

sentences.english: Between "everywhere" and "forever" there is no compromise.
sentences.chinese: “處處”和“永遠”之間是沒有妥協可言的。

definition: counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
to persuade/to convince/to talk sb over/Taiwan pr. [shui4 fu2]
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
to concede/to give in/to yield/a concession/(linguistics) concessive
to yield/to adapt to/to accommodate to (sth)
